byline.contributor: Mohamad Fahim Abed and Mujib Mashal contributed reporting.

abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani bears heavy burden of making condolence calls to family members of security force members killed in fight against Taliban; calls and high number of casualties, which in 2016 are on track to beat 2015 record of 6,000 soldiers, reflects steep challenge faced by government in stemming violence.

headline.print_headline: A Consoler in Chief to Afghans in Wartime
headline.main: In Wartime, Ghani Assumes Role of Comforting Afghans

snippet: President Ashraf Ghani, whose security forces in 2015 sustained their highest death toll in years, has for months made condolence calls to relatives of those killed....
lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani, whose security forces in 2015 sustained their highest death toll in years, has for months made condolence calls to relatives of those killed.
